--- title: "Clase teórica Semana 15" subtitle: "Repaso" author: "Marylia Cruz" date: "2025-06-09" format: html execute: echo: true message: false df-print: paged code-annotations: hover --- # Ejercicio de repaso ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(rio) data2=import("youtube_data.csv") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} names(data2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "video_id" "title" "description" "published_date" [5] "channel_id" "channel_title" "tags" "category_id" [9] "view_count" "like_count" "comment_count" "duration" [13] "thumbnail" ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} str(data2$view_count) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` num [1:600] 8962092 289626 81372201 21255964 2790436 ... ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} str(data2$like_count) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` num [1:600] 243350 3393 4178447 909386 44278 ... ``` ::: ::: # Existe una relación entre el número de vistas y el número de likes? ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} cor.test(data2$view_count,data2$like_count) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Pearson's product-moment correlation data: data2$view_count and data2$like_count t = 23.975, df = 598, p-value < 2.2e-16 alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0 95 percent confidence interval: 0.6568404 0.7387255 sample estimates: cor 0.7000773 ``` ::: ::: # Gráfico de dispersión ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) ggplot(data2, aes(x = view_count, y = like_count)) + geom_point() + labs(title = "Diagrama de dispersión", x = "Eje X", y = "Eje Y") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](semana15_teoria_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: # Calculamos la variable es_tech por si se repite un patrón en tags ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data2$es_tech=ifelse(grepl("'tech'",data2$tags),1,0) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} table(data2$es_tech) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 0 1 538 62 ``` ::: ::: # Existe una diferente de medias del número de likes entre los videos que pertenecen al grupo tech o no ? ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} t.test(like_count~es_tech,data=data2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Welch Two Sample t-test data: like_count by es_tech t = -2.3555, df = 65.953, p-value = 0.02148 alternative hypothesis: true difference in means between group 0 and group 1 is not equal to 0 95 percent confidence interval: -440840.7 -36354.8 sample estimates: mean in group 0 mean in group 1 192809.5 431407.3 ``` ::: ::: # Gráfico de barras de error ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(lsr) library(dplyr) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'dplyr' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': filter, lag ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:base': intersect, setdiff, setequal, union ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} tabla=data2%>% group_by(es_tech)%>% summarise( promedio=mean(like_count), linferior=ciMean(like_count)[1], lsuperior=ciMean(like_count)[2] ) tabla ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) ggplot(tabla, aes(x = es_tech, y = promedio)) + geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = linferior, ymax = lsuperior), width = 0.2) + labs(x = "Si es tech o no", y = "Media ± IC 95%") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](semana15_teoria_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
